title: PromptStack Architecture Product Building
summary: PromptStack founder's vision for streamlining product development from concept to revenue, with emphasis on customer-centric thinking and minimal viable features using AI-powered workflows
key_points: Target market: Solo founders and micro-teams who can't afford traditional dev teams
Core philosophy: Get from 0 to 1 fast, then optimize when you have revenue
PromptStack democratizes product building for non-technical founders
Focus on customer thinking over technical implementation details
Build revenue-generating MVPs with minimal features that solve real problems
hooks: Stop being distracted by what you're building - focus on WHO you're building for
The biggest startup problem: Building features nobody asked for
How to think like a customer-obsessed founder, not a feature-obsessed builder
quotable_moments: Being distracted by what you're building versus being obsessed with who you're building for - that's the biggest problem
You don't need your interface to be cutting edge. You just need it to be useful
Get from 0 to 1 fast. Get from something that makes money so you can pay for more resources
review_notes: Passionate founder manifesto emphasizing customer-centric product development. Strong philosophical stance on building for revenue vs perfection. Would benefit from concrete examples or case studies.
